body_html:
Something is really wrong, because on Ubuntu 17.04, I had 375.39 installed and Tensorflow looked for 375.51:

ImportError: libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.375.51: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Problem was, I couldn't update to 375.51, because of dependency errors (see above).
On Ubuntu 16.04.2 (respective KDE Neon, which uses Ubuntu 16.04) I installed via the deb package and I have 375.39 installed. – No problems at all!
body_text:

ImportError: libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.375.51: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Problem was, I couldn't update to 375.51, because of dependency errors (see above).
On Ubuntu 16.04.2 (respective KDE Neon, which uses Ubuntu 16.04) I installed via the deb package and I have 375.39 installed. – No problems at all!
body:
Something is really wrong, because on Ubuntu 17.04, I had 375.39 installed and Tensorflow looked for 375.51:

```
ImportError: libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.375.51: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
Problem was, I couldn't update to 375.51, because of dependency errors (see above).
On Ubuntu 16.04.2 (respective KDE Neon, which uses Ubuntu 16.04) I installed via the deb package and I have 375.39 installed. – No problems at all!
